wikipedia_page.main: Sir Gordon Charles Brunton (27 December 1921 – 30 May 2017) was a British businessman, publisher, racehorse owner and breeder.

link_mentions.page: List of people associated with the London School of Economics
response: * Sir Gordon Brunton, Chief Executive of Thomson Corporation, former Chairman of Sotheby's

Indian Queen was a chestnut mare bred by her owner Sir Gordon Brunton at the North Munstead Stud. She was sired by Electric out of Taj Princess (Taj Dewan). She was trained by the then Royal trainer William Hastings-Bass, 17th Earl of Huntingdon, at West Ilsley in Berkshire.

In 1977 he founded the British audio manufacturer, Mission Electronics in Cambridge. This was followed by other well-known startups, notably Cyrus Electronics and later, NXT plc together with Sir Gordon Brunton.  The Company licensed patented technologies to multinationals in consumer electronics.  Cyrus Electronics manufactures specialist equipment with a serious following among the audiophile community.

In 1972, Pollen became vice-chairman of Sotheby's and returned to England. As the largest private shareholder in the company (with five percent), Pollen was considered the likely successor of Wilson until the company began losing money which many blamed on over-expansion. When Gordon Brunton was made the chairman after Wilson's retirement, Pollen left the company, retiring in 1982.
